Package me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.cache

Class StorageCache

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.cache.StorageCache
public class StorageCache extends Object
Caches all data into paths that have been retrieved from StorageContainers. This cache will be checked first before attempting to retrieve data from a StorageContainer again. Data in this cache will expire, and can be changed by using StorageSettings.setCacheDuration(int)

  • Constructor Details

    • StorageCache

      public StorageCache(StorageContainer container, int cacheDuration)
      Parameters:
      container - The StorageContainer that this cache attaches to.
      cacheDuration - How long to cache the object for. Set to -1 to cache forever

  • Method Details

    • cache

      public void cache(String path, Object obj)
      Caches a path to an object with the default cache duration.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the object.
      obj - The object to cache.

    • cache

      public void cache(String path, Object obj, int cacheDuration)
      Caches a path to an object with a custom cache duration, specified in seconds.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the object.
      obj - The object to cache.
      cacheDuration - How long, in seconds, an object should be kept in the cache for.

    • get

      public CachedObject get(String path)
      Gets an object from the cache. Getting an item from the cache will reset its cache removal timer.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to get
      Returns:
      The cached Object

    • remove

      public void remove(String path)
      Removes a path from the cache.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to remove.

    • remove

      public void remove(CachedObject object)
      Removes a CachedObject from the cache.
      Parameters:
      object - The CachedObject to remove.

    • flush

      public CompletableFuture<Void> flush()
      Updates the StorageContainer with the set and remove caches. After flushing, these maps will be cleared. Flushing will not empty the cached data, only the data that needs to be updated to the structure.
      Returns:
      A future that is completed once the flush has finished.
      See Also:
      • for adding objects into the Set cache.
      • for adding paths into the Remove cache.

    • isCached

      public boolean isCached(String path)
      Returns if the provided path is cached.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to check.
      Returns:
      If the path is cached.

    • clearCache

      public void clearCache()
      Clears the cache.

    • getContainer

      public StorageContainer getContainer()
      Returns the StorageContainer that this cache is caching for.
      Returns:
      The StorageContainer.

    • getFlushTask

      public FlushTask getFlushTask()
      Returns the FlushTask that defines when this cache is flushed.
      Returns:
      The FlushTask.

    • getCacheDuration

      public int getCacheDuration()
      Returns the default cache duration, in seconds, for objects.
      Returns:
      The cache duration
      See Also:
      • cache(String, Object)

    • getCache

      public Map<String,CachedObject> getCache()
      Returns the cache map.
      Returns:
      The cache map

    • getSetCache

      public Map<String,Object> getSetCache()
      Returns the cache of objects that have been set and not updated to the data structure. This cache is cleared once the cache has been pushed to the structure.
      Returns:
      The current set cache

    • getRemoveCache

      public List<String> getRemoveCache()
      Returns the cache of objects that have been removed and not updated to the data structure. This cache is cleared once the cache has been pushed to the structure.
      Returns:
      The current remove cache
